Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Joan Roelofs Collection on the Green Movement TAM 651
1 Linear Feet in 1 record carton
1970-1995 Joan Roelofs was Professor of Political Science at Keene State College from 1979 until 2012 specializing in green public adminsitration, the political power of foundations and the ideas of pre-Marxist socialist Charles Fourier. She is the author of Greening Cities: Building Just, Sustainable Communities, and Foundations and Public Policy. She is also a practitioner of book arts. This collection consists of various papers, articles, notes and fliers regarding the environment, labor issues and the socio-political situation in America during the late-20th century; as well as issues of numerous publications examining contemporary issues in climate change, environmental politics, and energy policy and development. Materials are in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Joan Roelofs in 2014. The accession number associated with this gift is 2014.149.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
Joan Roelofs was Professor of Political Science at Keene State College from 1979 until 2012 specializing in green public adminsitration, the political power of foundations and the ideas of pre-Marxist socialist Charles Fourier. She is the author of Greening Cities: Building Just, Sustainable Communities, and Foundations and Public Policy. She is also a practitioner of book arts.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Joan Roelofs Collection on the Green Movement; TAM 651; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were housed in acid-free folders and boxes, and a collection-level record was created. No physical arrangement was performed.
Scope and Content Note
This collection consists of various papers, articles, notes and flyers regarding the environment, labor issues and the socio-political situation in America during the late-20th century; as well as issues of numerous publications examining contemporary issues in climate change, environmental politics, and energy policy and development. The collection includes multiple issues of Green Politics and Synthesis/Regeneration.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Joan Roelofs, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2014 by Joan Roelofs.
